basic.description: A course on globalizing agrarian problems.  Pressures on agrarian societies are considered in relation to environmental history and the history of environmentalism.  An overview of relevant literature illuminates challenges and transformations since 1900, including Green Revolutions and the weakening of collectivist modes of production.  Discussion of current scholarly trends examines research on past practices as patterns of ecological sustainability.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: Topics in Global Agrarian & Environmental History
